bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 6, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes about Mabel Lazear's trip home. He has finished a paper on malaria but will still do more research. He is currently doing bacteriological work.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 6, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
Columbia Barracks
Havana Cuba
BALTIMORE. Apr. 6, 1900
My dear Mother,
div1.p:
I received a letter from you the
day after I wrote last and another today both
of which I was glad to get.

Mabel's steamer the Sedgevick left New York three
days ago. She goes direct to Cienfuegos on
the South Coast of Cuba and then comes
here. That will probably make her leave here
about Apr. 14 and she will probably reach
New York about the eighteenth. She lands at
the Navy Yard in Brooklyn and if it is early
in the day Mabel will go directly to the Annex
ferry otherwise she will stay over night
at the Bayard. We have been going about
a good deal lately seeing all that is to
be seen. I got Mabel a Kodak and
she has been taking a lot of pictures
many of which are very interesting.

It will be very nice for Mabel to be able
to gobe out at Windsor when she is in
Baltimore.

I have just finished a paper on malaria which
I have been working at for some time.
Dr. Thayer will read it at the Medical Society
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.
and it will be published soon I hope
It will have a member of illustrations.
I am also to have a paper for the
American Medical Association which meets
early in June Dr. Futcher is to read this
one for me. I am finding plenty of malaria
here although the season has not yet
begun and I am planning for some
interesting work later on. I do the bacteriological
work for the division, which includes the
posts at Guanajoy and Pinar del Rio as well
as this one. They send me the material
by mail and I telegraph the answers
I am looking looking forward to making a
trip to one of the bad malarial regions
for the purpose of making an investigation.
Give my love to Aunt Kate and the rest
